Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.191)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36459) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36459)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 319 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13505 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
